The Morning Download: Future of Government Data Science Hangs on Leadership
articles.Description: Good Morning. The dark days of government tech competency are over, at least for now, CIO Journal Columnist Tom Davenport says. "Your national government may have had some problems with IT in the past—a range of disasters come to mind—but now the U.S. seems to have some of the best IT people in the country," he says.

articles.Title: The Role Of Data Science (IT Best Kept Secret Is Optimization)
articles.Description:
I am sure I'll get flamed for this post, given how hyped data science is.  Let me first say that I do not pretend to define what data science is, others, probably more qualified than me, have done it well.   For instance, I like this definition from Dawen Peng, as it speaks to an Operations Research person like me.  I will rather focus on the role data science can have for business.  What I see the most is data scientists analyzing data then publishing reports on insights they found in data.  Just browse over the numerous data science blogs to get examples. 
 
	So far so good? Here comes the flame...

articles.Description: Statistical analysis and mining of huge multi-terabyte data sets is a common task nowadays, especially in the areas like web analytics and Internet advertising. Analysis of such large data sets often requires powerful distributed data stores like Hadoop and heavy data processing with techniques like MapReduce.
